item.description:
Hi folks! Let's enjoy the last of the fall foliage while we get some exercise, walking and talking with friends in the crispy fall air.

LOCATION: This Meetup will take place at Sleeping Giant, which is a Connecticut State Park located in Hamden.

PLAN: Sleeping Giant is a great park for any level of hiking. We will walk our usual tower trail, which is relatively short, has a mild incline, and requires very little maneuvering over rocky places. We will have a break at the tower for snacks and chit chat, and if there is interest, we can split up into two groups after our break -- some members walking back down the tower road (totaling a 1.5 hour hike), and other members heading down the blue trail, if they desire a greater challenge (2+ hour hike).

WHEN AND WHERE: Meet at the big trail map at the Park entrance, which is located on Mt. Carmel Avenue, between 8:45 and 9, and we'll try to get rolling onto the trail by five after 9.

BRING: One or two bottles of water!, and a snack if you like.

WEAR: Hiking or other sturdy shoes with treads; layers of clothing; warm socks, hat and gloves.

COST: We ask for a donation of one dollar, towards the monthly fee that is charged by the Meetup Website. Please bring any contributions with you on the day of the hike.

DIRECTIONS: Please see Sleeping Giant State Park Website.

PARKING NOTE: The DEP sometimes charges a fee to park in the lot. Please take advantage of the street parking on Mt. Carmel Avenue, adjacent to park, ACROSS FROM (not inside) Quinnipiac University.

Trail maps are usually available at the park entrance, if you are interested.

group.name: New Haven Walks in the Woods

item.name: New Haven Hikers' Sleeping Giant Walk
